metatags.og:description: TEHRAN, Iran (AP) — The largest warship in the Iranian navy caught fire and later sank Wednesday in the Gulf of Oman under unclear circumstances, the latest calamity to strike one of the country’s vessels in recent years amid tensions with the West.

metatags.og:description: The Iranian navy's largest ship sank after catching fire in the Gulf of Oman, where mysterious explosions have hit other vessels in recent years.
metatags.twitter:image:alt: This undated photo provided by the Iranian army shows navy's support ship Kharg. The Kharg, the largest warship in the Iranian navy, caught fire and later sank Wednesday, June 2, 2021, in the Gulf of Oman under unclear circumstances, semiofficial news agencies reported. (Iranian army via AP)
metatags.og:image:alt: This undated photo provided by the Iranian army shows navy's support ship Kharg. The Kharg, the largest warship in the Iranian navy, caught fire and later sank Wednesday, June 2, 2021, in the Gulf of Oman under unclear circumstances, semiofficial news agencies reported. (Iranian army via AP)
